[color=#ff0000][size=3]REMINDER:
1.This is NOT a mod.
2.This is for Everyone with or without Performance Problem.
3.This may or may not work for you.
4.The Performance gain still depends on your PC.
5.If This guide somehow offended your mod, Kindly Message me.
6.This is a Performance Guide so NO Visual ENB Tested.
7.My English is not that good.
8. I only added the Important/Common Used mod in the list
9.NO LOLLYGAGGING.[/size]
[size=6]10. RESULTS MAY VARY.
[/size]
[/color]

[size=4]                                                                      INTRODUCTION
[/size][size=3]I Started Playing Skyrim for more than 3 Years now And i have encountered tons of questions about which mod is Performance Friendly and Which are not, Also which are Script Heavy and Which Are not. Have you ever wonder why your unmodded skyrim runs (Ex: 40-60Fps) and why your modded skyrim runs (Ex: 20-30fps) only? That is my main goal on this guide. I created this guide to help peoples with both Low-End and High-End PC to choose Properly and have better performance and stability. i gathered all my knowledge about the mods and configs to share and help fellow skyrim players. This guide will help you play skyrim with better performance without lowering visual quality or removing it but making it look better or atleast help you pick the right mods suitable for your PC. It took me 6+ Hours every time i Reinstall Skyrim and Mods Every 50 Mods and took me 5+ Hours to test them every day that took 2 Months to finish testing thousands of Mods that i lost count resulting on me falling sleep in front of my computer everytime :( So please appriciate the effort and patience i gave to create this :)[/size]

[size=3]The Specs of Tested PC:
[color=#1e84cc]CPU: Intel i5 650 3.20 Ghz[/color]
[color=#ff0000]GPU: AMD HD5450 2Gb DDR3 OC`d
[/color][color=#00ff00]RAM: 4Gb DDR3 1.3Ghz
[/color][color=#000000]HDD: WD 500Gb[/color][/size]

[size=2]Actual Gameplay Performance:
30 - 40 Fps Avg.
Medium Setting
201 Mods installed

[/size][size=3]MODS NOT IN THIS LIST:
Animation
Player Homes
Follower
New Places
SOUNDS
PATCHES 
FIXES
And some, Please Read Instruction Reminder #9[/size]
[size=2]
[/size]
NOTE: IM CURRENTLY TESTING ALL THE PERFORMANCE MOD I CAN FIND AND WILL ADD THEM TO THE LIST SOON. ( WORKING ONLY )

[size=5]This will be your Guide:[/size]
[size=2][color=#1e84cc]< = Low Performance Hit ( 1-3 FPS ) / Light Script[/color]
[color=#ffff00]<< = Medium Performance Hit ( 4-8 FPS ) / Medium Script[/color]
[color=#ff0000]<<< = High Performance Hit ( 8+ FPS ) / Heavy Script[/color]
[color=#00ff00]+ = Performance Gain[/color]
0 = Neutral[/size]

[size=5]STABILITY
Note: If you want more in-depth information about every single lines. Please Visit their page. But this lines is the best settings i know and tested to date.

[/size][size=3]Requirements:
ENBoost
SKSE or SSME ( Choose one )
[/size]

[size=5]ENB Config: ( Located in Skyrim Root Folder )[/size]

[size=3][PROXY][/size]
[size=3]EnableProxyLibrary=false[/size]
[size=3]InitProxyFunctions=true[/size]
[size=3]ProxyLibrary=other_d3d9.dll[/size]
[size=3][GLOBAL][/size]
[size=3]UsePatchSpeedhackWithoutGraphics=true      - Set to true will load ENBoost ONLY[/size]
[size=3]UseDefferedRendering=false                         - Set to true for slightly better performance[/size]
[size=3]IgnoreCreationKit=true[/size]
[size=3][PERFORMANCE][/size]
[size=3]SpeedHack=true                                           - Main[/size]
[size=3]EnableOcclusionCulling=true                        - Object not in your view will be culled ( Performance gain )[/size]
[size=3][MEMORY][/size]
[size=3]ExpandSystemMemoryX64=false                     - I leave this to false even i have 64bit OS[/size]
[size=3]ReduceSystemMemoryUsage=true                  -Set to true for more available memory [/size]
[size=3]DisableDriverMemoryManager=false               -Leave this value unless you know what you are doing[/size]
[size=3]DisablePreloadToVRAM=false                         - Its like Procedurally loaded textures [/size]
[size=3]EnableUnsafeMemoryHacks=false                  -Leave this value unless you know what you are doing[/size]
[size=3]ReservedMemorySizeMb=256                         - Lower Values Provide better stability but more stutter. 64, 128, 256 and 512[/size]
[size=3]VideoMemorySizeMb=2048                            - [ RAM - VRAM ][/size]
[size=3]EnableCompression=false                             - Set to true will save much more RAM but will Badly stutter[/size]
[size=3]AutodetectVideoMemorySize=false               - Sometimes Inaccurate[/size]
[size=3][THREADS][/size]
[size=3]DataSyncMode=2                                         - May or May Not help prevent CTD   ( ENB Anti-Crash ) ( 0,1,2 )[/size]
[size=3]PriorityMode=3                                           - May or May Not help prevent CTD    ( ENB Anti-Crash ) ( 0,1,2,3,4 )[/size]
[size=3]EnableUnsafeFixes=false[/size]
[size=3][MULTIHEAD][/size]
[size=3]ForceVideoAdapterIndex=false[/size]
[size=3]VideoAdapterIndex=0[/size]
[size=3][WINDOW][/size]
[size=3]ForceBorderless=false                                   *Experimental ( May or May NOT give you fps boost )[/size]
[size=3]ForceBorderlessFullscreen=false                    *Experimental ( May or May NOT give you fps boost )[/size]
[size=3][ENGINE][/size]
[size=3]ForceAnisotropicFiltering=true                       -Set to true will activate Anisotropic Filtering ( ENB )[/size]
[size=3]MaxAnisotropy=8                                          -x8 and x16 look the same but x8 will give better performance ( 0.5-1 fps )[/size]
[size=3]ForceLodBias=false[/size]
[size=3]LodBias=0.0[/size]
[size=3]AddDisplaySuperSamplingResolutions=false[/size]
[size=3]EnableVSync=false                                       -Set to true will activate V-Sync ( ENB ) ( Not recommended for Low-End PC )[/size]
[size=3]VSyncSkipNumFrames=0[/size]
[size=3][LIMITER][/size]
[size=3]WaitBusyRenderer=false                               [/size]
[size=3]EnableFPSLimit=false[/size]
[size=3]FPSLimit=60.0[/size]
[size=3][INPUT][/size]
[size=3]//shift[/size]
[size=3]KeyCombination=16[/size]
[size=3]//f12[/size]
[size=3]KeyUseEffect=123[/size]
[size=3]//home[/size]
[size=3]KeyFPSLimit=36[/size]
[size=3]//num /       106[/size]
[size=3]KeyShowFPS=106[/size]
[size=3]//print screen[/size]
[size=3]KeyScreenshot=44                                        -Screenshot ( Printscreen key )[/size]
[size=3]//enter[/size]
[size=3]KeyEditor=13[/size]
[size=3]//f4[/size]
[size=3]KeyFreeVRAM=115                                        -In-Game Ram Clearer ( F4 Key )[/size]
[size=3]//B[/size]
[size=3]KeyBruteForce=66[/size]
[size=3][ADAPTIVEQUALITY][/size]
[size=3]Enable=false[/size]
[size=3]Quality=1[/size]
[size=3]DesiredFPS=60.0[/size]
[size=3][ANTIALIASING][/size]
[size=3]EnableEdgeAA=false[/size]
[size=3]EnableTemporalAA=false[/size]
[size=3]EnableSubPixelAA=false[/size]
[size=3][FIX][/size]
[size=3]FixGameBugs=true[/size]
[size=3]FixParallaxBugs=true[/size]
[size=3]FixParallaxTerrain=false                             -Set to true if using Parallax mod to take effect[/size]
[size=3]FixAliasedTextures=true[/size]
[size=3]IgnoreInventory=true[/size]
[size=3]FixTintGamma=true[/size]
[size=3]RemoveBlur=false[/size]
[size=3]FixSubSurfaceScattering=true[/size]
[size=3]FixSkyReflection=true[/size]
[size=3]FixCursorVisibility=true[/size]
[size=3]FixLag=false[/size]




[size=3] [/size]
[size=5]SKSE Config:    ( Located in Skyrim/Data/SKSE )[/size]

[size=3][Display][/size]
[size=3]iTintTextureResolution=2048[/size]
[size=3][General][/size]
[size=3]ClearInvalidRegistrations=1[/size]
[size=3]EnableDiagnostics=1[/size]
[size=3][Memory][/size]
[size=3]DefaultHeapInitialAllocMB=768[/size]
[size=3]ScrapHeapSizeMB=256[/size]





[size=5]Papyrus Config:  ( Located in Documents/Skyrim/Skyrim ini. )[/size]
[color=#ff0000][size=2]NOTE: This is Experimental only and May or May NOT Work for Everyone . Alter this line if you really know what you are doing.[/size]
[size=4] USE AT YOUR OWN RISK[/size][/color]

[size=3][Papyrus]
fUpdateBudgetMS=10.0                        -1.2 for default. Max Seconds for scripts to be loaded
fExtraTaskletBudgetMS=10.0                 -1.2 for default. Max Seconds for scripts to be loaded
fPostLoadUpdateTimeMS=2000.0            -500 for default. Less Stutter and more Stable with 2000. Helps the lines above.
iMinMemoryPageSize=128                      
iMaxMemoryPageSize=512
iMaxAllocatedMemoryBytes=76800
bEnableLogging=0
bEnableTrace=0
bLoadDebugInformation=0
bEnableProfiling=0[/size]


[size=3]TIPS:[/size]
[size=3]This is for those who really want to squeeze performance out of their PC..[/size]
[size=3]Clean your PC and Do the Following Every Month:[/size]

[size=3][color=#1e84cc]CPU[/color] - Clean Fans and Reaplly Thermal Paste, No OC needed.[/size]

[size=3][color=#ff0000]GPU[/color] - Clean Fans and Make sure your GPU Have a good cooling thingy. Put a Powerful External Fans directed to it if needed, Its funny but it really works.  Never let your GPU Heat up above 50 celsius or else, Performance will suffer. I experimented with the HD5450 while on whiterun and monitored it.[/size]
[color=#38761d][size=3]40 Celsius = 43Fps[/size][/color]
[color=#6aa84f][size=3]45 Celsius = 39Fps[/size][/color]
[color=#f1c232][size=3]50 Celsius = 37Fps[/size][/color]
[color=#ffff00][size=3]55 Celsius = 33Fps[/size][/color]
[color=#e06666][size=3]60 Celsius = 31Fps[/size][/color]
[color=#a61c00][size=3]65 Celsius = 25Fps[/size][/color]

[size=3][color=#00ff00]RAM[/color]: N/A

[color=#000000]HDD[/color]: Defrag all drives for faster loading times on gaming.

OPTIONAL:
IoBit Game Booster v3.5 - This Helped Me gain 2-3 FPS and maybe for you too.
CleanMem - This gives me more available ram memory ( For stability ).



Another Problem is the CTD, Well i play skyrim with 201 Mods without Crashes.First I cant really say how to cure the CTD. Because each and everyone of use uses different mods and PC`s so it would be too complicated. All i can is to Prevent it so i added the stability guide here too. My Advice, Carefully Read the instructions of Every mod you`re using and install the appropriate patches for it to work with each other, Not against each other.

List of what really causes CTD:
1. INCOMPATABILITY
2. TOO MUCH AND TOO HEAVY SCRIPTS
3. Conflicting mods
4. Insuficient Resources
5. Load Order ( some mods may not properly work when not in the right load order )

Tips: ( This might take hours or days to finish if your really into preventing CTD )
1. Use mods with no script
2. Use alternative mod with lighter scripts
3. Use patches ( that`s why they are created ) 
4. Review your mods ( like what they do ) Maybe youre using 2+ mods that do the same thing.
5. Install only the necesarry mods.
6. Know your PC limits.

Common Performance Tips:
1. Lower Resolution to 1024x720 if really needed.
2. Disable AA , Use FXAA if you cant live without it.
3. Set Texture Quality to Medium for Better Performance and More Memory.
4. Anisotropic filtering x8 looks exactly as x16 but with better performance.
5. Set Shadows to low for much better performance.
6. Set all fade level to medium settings for better performance.
7. Set Distant Detail to Medium for less stuttering .
8. Turn off V-Sync. ( PresetInterval = 0 )
8. Experiment with your SkyrimPrefs. ( If You Know what you are doing )
[/size]

[size=4]Well, Thats really it. I hope this can be somehow of help to everyone with questions and problems on playing Skyrim. Please, Kindly Share this to anyone you see having a problem on running skyrim. And lets make this page known so it can help more players in the future. I hope you appriciate this. I will Try to add more mods and update this if i have the time. And all questions will be answered as soon as possible. Im currently Planning to create my own Performance Mod :)[/size]
